item.description: Call at 4:30a, e-editions down all properties, worked to solve problem all day, yelled at kids a lot! Thinking not worth it. Dillan marched in Springville Heritage Parade; Honor Guard, carried Boy Scout flag; boys lots of candy, Ashley with McCluskeys. Dillan and Ashley ballgame.

item.title: Status Update – June 15, 2018
item.description: Friday! Took Dillan and Ashley to daycare, Dwyane and Bruce to dentist. Bruce has 3 cavities, needs 2 crowns, 1 filling; he’s been sneaking candy, finding wrappers around bed. Worked at Times-Mail. Lesa finished class, went grocery shopping, got pizzas! Dwyane and Bruce ballgame.

item.title: Status Update – June 14, 2018
item.description: Waited with Bruce, walked him to bus, took Dillan to class. Went to work. Lesa at home. Picked Dillan up at 11, went to Kay’s to get my resized ring, McDonald’s. Picked up Bruce at noon, drove them both to Mitchell Pool. Lesa took care of boys so I took big kids to baseball game.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 14, 2018
item.description: Dave: Did you see that horse laying down sleeping? Lesa: That’s kind of unusual to see. Dave: Did you know horses can snooze standing up? Ashley: Do they sleep and walk? Dave: No. Ashley: They can’t sleep and walk, but I do!

item.title: Status Update – June 13, 2018
item.description: Kids daycare, Lesa home, Times-Mail me. Dillan took practice iRead test, thinks he’s prepared, I’m not convinced. Worked late, picked kids up last minute. No evening plans, probably good thing, everyone is tired. Ashley smarted/squared off against Lesa, got whopped. Nice day out.

item.title: Status Update – June 12, 2018
item.description: Rained third day straight! Daycare open. Worked from Times-Mail, Lesa still taking online class at home. Dillan and Bruce went to school, Dillan close to done, hope he does well on the iRead! Dillan and Ashley baseball game was canceled. Ashley piano lessons. Kids better behaved.

item.title: Status Update – June 11, 2018
item.description: Power out overnight, on by morning. Daycare closed, no power. Took Dillan, Bruce to school; Ashley, Dwyane stayed home. Lesa home taking online class. McDonald’s lunch with Dillan, Wendy’s Frosties. Kids buttholes all day. Dog after chickens. Rural King, Walmart. Raccoon by coop.

item.title: Status Update – June 10, 2018
item.description: Jump started truck. Church, Bruce’s first day of Junior Church, I was his teacher. Went to Camp Na Wa Kwa Open House, checked out Yurt we’ll be sleeping in, Ashley excited. On way home visited Martina Dale, fed donkeys. Truck alternator not charging. Dirt bike, swimming. tablets.

item.title: Status Update – June 9, 2018
item.description: Bruce woke us up, said he had sunburn. Dwyane and Bruce baseball practice at 9a, Dillan and Ashley at 10a. Ate lunch, made kids take a nap. Drove toward Fairfax Beach, saw storm on horizon, turned around, went to Mitchell Pool instead, had a lot of fun. Tacos! Watched NHRA on TV.

item.title: Status Update – June 8, 2018
item.description: Exact repeat of yesterday minus Bruce nearly drowning. I bought Springville Store pizzas, Lesa missed my call, made pizzas at home. Dwyane and Bruce makeup game, we all went. Found Dwyane’s missing glove in lost-and-found, two hats still missing. Kids tired, sent straight to bed!

item.title: Status Update – June 7, 2018
item.description: Same morning as yesterday. At noon, picked up Dillan and Bruce from Parkview, drove them to Mitchell Pool, they joined daycare field trip, left them with Jessica. Heard later Bruce ignored teacher, ran and jumped in pool over his head and sunk, Dillan got him out. Kids are tired!

item.title: Status Update – June 6, 2018
item.description: Dropped kids at daycare. Bruce wanted me to walk him to bus, I wanted him to go on his own. Stacie got Dillan okay. Worked at Times-Mail. Text from Jerry Davis, set appointment with Classic Title to buy land on 6⁄19. Dillan played at Gabe’s all evening. Ashley, boys swam in pool.

item.title: Status Update – June 5, 2018
item.description: Took kids to daycare, Bruce asked me to walk him to bus, so I did, Stacie Kidd picked up Dillan. Worked at Times-Mail. Picked up kids, ate pizza. Lesa took Dillan to his ballgame with Dwyane and Bruce. Ashley skipped game, I took her to first piano lesson with Loretta Harrington.

item.title: Status Update – June 4, 2018
item.description: Kids to daycare, worked at Times-Mail. Bruce’s first day of Kindergarten Countdown, walked him to bus, he’s getting big, I feel lucky and loved. Took Dillan to iRead Remediation, picked up, told me he paid attention entire time. Dwyane and Bruce had ballgame. Ashley doing better.

item.title: Status Update – June 3, 2018
item.description: Family Sunday, Serving Deacon, Ashley still sick, Lesa stayed home with her, Dwyane and Kindergarten Graduation. Bloomington Walmart with boys, got pool. Wendy’s for lunch by popular vote. Cash and Alexis Howard, neighbors came over. Filled pool. Back to church, Ashley went with.

item.title: Status Update – June 2, 2018
item.description: Cut grass before heat. Called doctor, Ashley strep throat, called in script. Lesa and Dillan Mom-Son day, Bloomington to play Laser Tag. I took kids to CVS, Kay Jewelers to get band resized, Walmart so Ashley could spend BD money, Orange Leaf. Grilled salmon. Kids played outside.

item.title: Status Update – June 1, 2018
item.description: Power outages from Louisville to Indy. Lesa worked. Dillan, Ashley dentist. Had kids all day; they got bored, wild and crazy. Generator trashed, won’t run, wires chewed by mice. Took kids to Times-Mail, tried to work some. Power back at 3:30p, off about 26 hours, off again at 9p.

item.title: Status Update – May 31, 2018
item.description: Took kids to daycare. Working when storm came in, power out, 2 trees down in Ashley Price’s yard blocking road. Daycare texted power out, pick up kids. Dragged trees off road with chains and truck, got kids, trees down all over! Dinner at Golden Corral, Walmart. Power stayed off.

item.title: Status Update – May 30, 2018
item.description: Took Dwyane and Bruce to daycare, Bruce rotten as usual. Dillan and Ashley rode bus to school, they played Human Scrabble, last day of school, brought home a lot of stuff. Worked until Lesa got home, productive work day. Kids excited to be done for year. Let them stay up until 9.

item.title: Status Update – May 29, 2018
item.description: School and work – in theory. Bruce strep throat and fever, kept home. Mrs. Dillman texted, Dwyane only student, picked up. Bruce to doctor, CVS for medicine. Signed kids up for swim lessons. Wendy’s lunch. Picked up Dillan and Ashley from school. Davises picked up land paperwork.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 29, 2018
item.description: Dwyane to Pauline McGuire: Schools weren’t invented yet when Mommy and Daddy were little.

item.title: Status Update – May 28, 2018
item.description: Memorial Day. Did nothing special, just laid around. Kids played outside morning/evening because it was cooler, played on tablets midday when it was hot. Lesa took them on several walks, by third one they lost interest. Very rambunctious and excitable. Refilled pool, cooled down.

item.title: Status Update – May 27, 2018
item.description: Family Sunday, donuts, honored high school grads. Rushed home, another light lunch. Off to Jay and Denise Dillmans’s for grandson Jay’s birthday: bouncy house, lots of food, nice pool, kids had fun time, us too. Jiffy Treat on way home, saw Beth Walker. Supper, TV, Indy 500, bed.

item.title: Status Update – May 26, 2018
item.description: Hauled recyclables, Ashley and Bruce went, bought them suckers at Dollar General afterward. Hauled a ton of trash next, all kids went. Ate light lunch. Paul and Andrea’s for annual Memorial Day cookout: swimming, water balloons, bikes, etc. Skipped the invite to Forest’s wedding.

item.title: Status Update – May 25, 2018
item.description: Ashley honors: Perfect Attendance, Honor Roll All Periods, Highest AR Points and Percentage, Academic Achievement Award, she did great! Dillan honors: Honor Roll 1 Period, Academic Improvement Award. We took all school kids home, Steak ‘n’ Shake lunch. Kids played outside. Pizza!

item.title: Status Update – May 24, 2018
item.description: Not that much going on today. Bruce sneaked some of his birthday toys into daycare, he almost lost them because daycare thought they belonged to them, lesson learned. Dillan and Ashley had a baseball game, we all went, both played fairly well, Ashley hit a single, their team won.

item.title: Status Update – May 23, 2018
item.description: Dropped off kids, Bruce. We went to Dwyane’s Kindergarten graduation. Citizenship Award! We must be doing something right! Signed him out, Pizza Hut buffet, Jiffy Treat ice cream. After school, picked up other three, Asian Pearl and Williams Bridge to celebrate one year adoption.

item.title: Status Update – May 22, 2018
item.description: Long workday. Dwyane had class picnic, Lesa went, ate with him, brought him home afterward, he played all afternoon. Ashley’s birthday, she’s 8 years old, time is flying! Strawberry shortcake, gifts, she’s happy. Our one year adoption anniversary, we didn’t visit Williams Bridge.

item.title: Status Update – May 21, 2018
item.description: I’m exhausted and the week is just starting! Working all weekend didn’t help any. Lesa on PTO all week. Darrell not doing well from sound of it, going to rehab, trouble on right side, doesn’t know who everyone is, just a week younger than me! Dillan and Ashley Game Day at school.

item.title: Status Update – May 20, 2018
item.description: Church, took Ella Carter her flowers, Paul and Andrea gave Bruce and Ashley birthday presents. Scout Crossover event at Springville Park, pitch-in lunch, awards ceremony, Dillan advanced to Webelos. Lesa went to Dollar General. Filled green pool, cold! Watched Oliver Twist on TV.

item.title: Status Update – May 18, 2018
item.description: Friday! Got yard mowed before work. Dillan had school picnic. Lesa off early, packed for Big Splash Adventure in French Lick, Ashley staying with Girl Scouts, got our own room, Pirate’s Cove. Arby’s, water park, pizza, lemonade, popcorn, all kids have injuries, having great time!

item.title: Status Update – May 17, 2018
item.description: Everyone tired! Ashley school picnic, great weather for it! Met soil scientist at property, he dug 5 pits, pretty interesting. Michelle Davis stopped by too. Land was good down to 42″ then turned to clay, good enough for septic, gonna buying. We all played with Bruce’s Nerf guns!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 17, 2018
item.description: Lesa to Dwyane: Are you blowing your boogers out so Porter will lick them? Dwyane: Yes. Lesa: Well, quit it.

item.title: Status Update – May 16, 2018
item.description: Bruce is 5! Took cookies to daycare. Work day sucked again. Lesa on phone: “I think I’m having a heart attack or something. Gotta go. Bye.” and hung up! Called her boss, indigestion. BD party, got most everything asked for, favorite gift: a $1 whoopee cushion from Dollar General.

item.title: Status Update – May 15, 2018
item.description: It’s our 36th anniversary, didn’t do a thing, not even cards! Rushed to get kids, dropped Ashley off for last Girl Scout meeting of season. Went home, grabbed Dillan and Ashley’s baseball shirts and gear for game and photos, Lesa left Scouts early so Ashley in picture, they lost.

item.title: Status Update – May 14, 2018
item.description: Springville School had their Run for Riley 2K. Dillan second in his class, ran entire way; Ashley first girl in her class to finish; Dwyane second in his class also. They had fun! We’re proud of them! Dwyane and Bruce had a ballgame, picture night. Dillan had Scouts, Ashley went.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 14, 2018
item.description: I avoided hitting a 6′ Black snake sunning itself on the road on our way home from camping and Bruce asked : Why is he laying in the road? Lesa: Because the road is the warmest place in the woods right now. He’s cold blooded so when it’s cold he get’s cold. The road is warm so he gets warm. Dillan: Daddy, can snakes live in trees? Dave: Yes. Dillan: Can they live in caves?

item.title: Status Update – May 13, 2018
item.description: Warm night, no one slept well except me, I slept fine, Bruce climbed in with Lesa, Ashley with me. After breakfast, we broke camp, cleaned up, headed home. Showers and baths! Mother’s Day, Lesa got our cards, I took her for Mexican to eat. Kids played outside. Hot, turned on A/C.

item.title: Status Update – May 12, 2018
item.description: Up early, skipped baseball practice, went camping at Camp Maumee. Kids ran, ate, played, ate, fished, ate, then we ate. Ashley got sick. Dillan didn’t pee himself. Stacie went home after we arrived, Jason showed up shortly after that. Had ticket, no signal, found out hours later.

item.title: Status Update – May 11, 2018
item.description: Lesa PTO. Dillan field trip to Marengo Cave, bought us souvenirs. Soil test good, buying land. Bruce stabbed girl in back with fork, got whopped! Walmart with kids for Mother’s Day, camping stuff. Lesa and Dwyane Muffins with Mom. All four kids ballgame, delayed camping until AM.

item.title: Status Update – May 10, 2018
item.description: Hot day! Game Day at school. Dwyane did good, won Big Wheel race, lapped other riders! We also won the sack race championship. I got tickets, missed conference call while there. Lesa picked up PTO flowers and delivered to Linda Wilson. Kids played outside, watched TV, took baths.

item.title: Status Update – May 9, 2018
item.description: School, daycare, work, home, sums it up. Permission to take soil sample, ordered it, scheduled for Friday. Rough work day. Warm, lower 80s. Bruce doesn’t like daycare; Dillan and Ashley said daycare okay but don’t like sharing space with babies. Kids played outside, ramps, swing.

item.title: Status Update – May 8, 2018
item.description: No school, Election Day, kids slept over an hour, daycare for all. Worked all day, missed a meeting, didn’t feel like quitting job. Picked up kids; tickets started! Took Scott to look at land, guess we’ll try to buy. Dillan and Ashley lost their first ballgame, neither had a hit.

item.title: Status Update – May 7, 2018
item.description: I’m still employed, ADP screwed up taxes, have to file amended return. New daycare open, Bruce had hard time. I’m tired, it’s only Monday. Talked to IUCU, we’re good to buy. Dillan Scouts, made first aid kit. Dwyane and Bruce first ballgame, The Milch Guy, purple shirts and hats.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 7, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: I got two scoops of ice cream. Ashley: Mommy, can I have three scoops of ice cream? Lesa: No. Bruce: I have to infinity and beyond scoops. Dwyane: That would be over the house and to the city ice cream. Bruce: Yeah.

item.title: Status Update – May 6, 2018
item.description: Church, security deacon, Family Sunday! Talked to Brian Price about buying home, land. Scott Schroyer will look at land Tuesday. Kids played outside all day! I cut grass, Lesa went shopping. Grilled brats, veggies. Dillan dirt bike. Boys ramped Big Wheels. Ashley played on swing.

item.title: Status Update – May 5, 2018
item.description: Dropped Ashley off for Girl Scout trip to Newport Aquarium at 7am. Rest of us spent morning looking at land. Talked to Home Center about modular home. McDonald’s. We want property on Steve Earl Rd! Printed zombie targets, Dillan BB gun. Ashley back at 9pm, gone 14 hours, worried!

item.title: Status Update – May 4, 2018
item.description: Friday, didn’t send resignation letter, sums up workday. Squirrel getting into coop stealing chicken food. Dwyane field trip to Sieboldt Quarry, had lots of fun! Imagination Station last day, all boys were in timeout! Lesa went grocery shopping. Shot BB gun, even Lesa and Ashley!

item.title: Status Update – May 3, 2018
item.description: Stormed this morning, rained all day. Duke replaced meter with digital one, bet electric bill goes up! Daycare about moved out. Dillan brought home two months of school papers, been hiding them in his desk. Lesa helped Dillan with spelling, Ashley read to us. I’m tired, Lesa too.

item.title: Status Update – May 2, 2018
item.description: Kept busy all day, lots of work to do. Nice day, didn’t get to enjoy any of it, upper 80s, seems really hot! Went to get kids when Lesa got home. They played and I worked some more. After supper kids played outside again, I adjusted swing chains to make them higher. TV and baths.

item.title: Status Update – May 1, 2018
item.description: No tickets today! Felt like I played hooky but I worked, closed auction last night, some problems today. Shorts and tee shirt day, in the eighties. Picked kids up early again. Boys played outside, Lesa took Ashley to Scouts. I took Dillan and Ashley to ball practice. Late to bed.

item.title: Status Update – April 30, 2018
item.description: Slow but busy day, not so much pressure. Really nice outside, picked up kids a little earlier so they could enjoy. Dwyane and Bruce had baseball practice, Lesa took them. Dillan had Scout Pack meeting, earned Polar Bear patch for camping in sub-freezing weather, Ashley went with.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 30, 2018
item.description: Dave: You better listen to your Mom! Bruce: You’re not the boss! Dillan and Ashley: Oh yes he is! Lesa: Bruce, you’d better listen. Bruce: Okay. Dave: And so it begins…

item.title: Status Update – April 29, 2018
item.description: Church, Cooks attending again, talked to Carl about cars. Kids played outside. I napped, Lesa took Bruce for long walk, Dillan rode dirt bike, Dwyane and Ashley tablets. Man in van asked Ashley where she lived, was our neighbor’s son, scared us! Water bottle rockets in afternoon.

item.title: Status Update – April 28, 2018
item.description: Dwyane and Bruce baseball practice at 9a, Dillan and Ashley practice at 10a. Ate lunch, did recyclables, cleaned yard; kids helped, worked hard. At 4p we went to Rally for Riley at Springville, placed winning bids on Dillan’s artwork and Ashley’s photo, missed Dwyane’s vase, fun.

item.title: Status Update – April 27, 2018
item.description: I worked from Times-Mail until noon. Talked with Principle Hudson before Donuts with Dad with Dwyane, he made me a key chain, home with me after. Lesa grocery shopped. Viewed two houses, we liked one. Springville Store for pizza. Nicolle emailed, asked for advice in writing kids.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 27, 2018
item.description: Lesa: Bruce, you have your very own lunch box. Ashley: I need a new one too. Lesa: No, I found yours. Ashley: Where? Lesa: In the pantry underneath a bunch of stuff. Dillan: Oh, I remember! It fell when I got mine that one time. Lesa: Well thanks for picking it up and putting it back where it belonged. Dwyane: Thank you Dillan. Bruce: Thanks Dillan. Ashley: Yeah, thanks Dillan.

item.title: Status Update – April 26, 2018
item.description: Work trudging along. Realtor said majority of houses we like are gone, looking at two tomorrow. So far no repercussions from Dillan’s behavior yesterday. Man walking toward school with shotgun caused school lock down. Ate at Asian Pearl. Nicolle emailed, she received PAVA letter.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 26, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, am I a famous dancer? Dave: You’re a good dancer and you have all the moves but I don’t think you’re famous yet. I bet someday. Dwyane: Mommy, do I got the moves? Lesa: Do you ever! You have the moves!

item.title: Status Update – April 25, 2018
item.description: Long, long day; finally finished working at 10:15pm. Emails from Nicolle asking about PAVA letter. Dillan in trouble at school, during art he got mad and in his notebook he had drawn 18 stick figures and wrote “Everyone’s dead in school but Dillan.” WTF‽ Talked with him, no clue.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 25, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, what is that delicious smell? [It was a pork roast.]

item.title: Status Update – April 24, 2018
item.description: Slower day, yet busy. Rain, rain, go away! Last day for PTO Flower money. Bruce did okay at daycare. They acted crazy at home. Checked out a house after supper, two others not available, will call realtor tomorrow. Bought four more .net domain names for the kids, cost me $1 each!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 24, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, will Mommy be awake when we get home? Dave: Yes. Bruce: But is it late? Dave: Yes, but it’s not our bedtime yet so she’ll be awake. Why? Bruce: Cause I want to hug and kiss her.

item.title: Status Update – April 23, 2018
item.description: Work, work, work, all work and no play. Rained all day until evening when sun peeked out. Kids rambunctious. Dillan didn’t return report card or turn in PTO Flower Sale money. Took Dillan to Scouts, watched Cyber-Bulling video, pics taken donating $500 to rebuild Springville gym.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 23, 2018
item.description: Bruce: I want a break from daycare and church. Lesa: Sounds like you need a vacation. Bruce: Yes, a vacation.

item.title: Status Update – April 22, 2018
item.description: Church, Serving Deacon, Arby’s, Great Clips haircuts, kids look good! Looked at some houses. Dillan rode dirt bike, learned to shift. Ashley, Dwyane, Bruce played on swings, Dillan joined them. Grilled salmon. Evening church, Ashley went. Dillan happy I got home, ran to greet me.

item.title: Status Update – April 21, 2018
item.description: Up early, frozen, fire, coffee, breakfast for boys, lake, play, lunch, broke camp, home. Girls lazy morning, Dollar General, Ashley Scout Badge Day at Cornerstone. Picked her up – surprised her. Neighbor/classmate Gage came over, all kids played outside, tired, slept like babies.

item.title: Status Update – April 20, 2018
item.description: Typical work/school/daycare day. Lesa off early, grocery shopped. Knocked off early too, loaded camping gear. Girls: homemade pizzas and movies. Boys: Maumee Scout Camp, no water, first ones there, set up tent, playing, chicken soup, campfire, S’mores, campfire stories, too cold!

item.title: Status Update – April 19, 2018
item.description: Bus, daycare, work from home, work sucks, new norm. Busy entire day until hour after Lesa got home. Left to get kids, stopped at BP to get cash from ATM to pay daycare. Supper. All kids went outside to play with Aiden and Logan; bike races, swing set, didn’t want to come back in.

item.title: Status Update – April 18, 2018
item.description: Kids rode bus, Bruce daycare, worked from home, horrible day, hanging tough, wore out tired. Got kids, they played outside, nice day. After dinner, kids played outside, then baths for boys, big kids out until 8 pm – played two hours with neighbor kids – swing set, bikes, running.

item.title: Status Update – April 17, 2018
item.description: Kids rode bus, thrilled, waited forever to ride. Bruce went to daycare. Worked from home, monitors came via FedEx, lots of work issues. Replaced Suburban rear brakes, LR caliper pin frozen, need carrier. Bruce’s chest hurt bad after dinner, at hospital 4 hours, x-rays, he’s okay.

item.title: Status Update – April 16, 2018
item.description: Took kids to daycare. Times-Mail no network, worked at home. Mailed Amended Tax Returns. Spent rest of day/evening working, bad workday, made it through. Picked up kids, drove to Bloomington with them for work. Mrs. Scott called, Dillan failed iRead test, we’re upset! Cub Scouts.

item.title: Status Update – April 15, 2018
item.description: Sunday, Church/Junior Church. Nice day, helped Dillan wash dirt bike. Grilled out salmon. Kids played outside. After supper Bruce started complaining of chest pain, blew it off at first, but he was in obvious pain, I took him to ER, he has muscle bruising. Worried us! Jr. Frosty.

item.title: Status Update – April 14, 2018
item.description: Raining, no baseball practice. Lesa girls day out shopping with Andrea. Waited for FedEx to deliver monitors for work, got tired of waiting, went into town. missed. Picked up Adjusted Tax Returns for 2014-16, getting $20,721 back! Showed kids new office. Took them to Jiffy Treat.

item.title: Status Update – April 13, 2018
item.description: Friday the 13th. School closed, FiberTech fire. Took kids to daycare, last day open, sad. Set up new office in Bedford, firewall misconfigured. Worked from home, busy-ass day, helped interview my potential new boss. Kids played with Dillan’s classmate Gabe down the street. Pizza!

item.title: Status Update – April 12, 2018
item.description: Another bad day, worked 11 hours in office, worked at home too, just finished. Lesa had to pick up kids, barely made it. Got office cleaned out, I move to Times-Mail in morning. Beautiful day, 78° when I left work, kids played outside. I forgot boys baseball practice due to work!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 12, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, can we watch a movie? Lesa: Not right now. Bruce: Mommy, can we go in the other room and talk about it?

item.title: Status Update – April 11, 2018
item.description: Didn’t think work could get worse, it did. Picked up kids, Forest’s last day, gave gift to Bruce, was nice of her. Came home and ate right away. Went to H&R Block, signed taxes, $13,227 refund! Worked on PAVA 2018 letter last night and tonight. Lesa less grouchy from not smoking.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 11, 2018
item.description: Ashley: How come the boys want to be with Mommy the most? Dave: For some reason, daughters like their dads the most, and sons like their moms the most. Ashley: Did Mommy like her dad too? Dave: Mommy loves her dad but he is gone so she doesn’t get to see and talk to him anymore. It’s very sad. Ashley: She can still talk to him and he will hear her in Heaven.

item.title: Status Update – April 10, 2018
item.description: Work simply sucked, I hate my job! Off too late to get kids, Lesa got Ashley, took her to Scouts. I got boys before closing and fixed supper, we ate as soon as Lesa and Ashley got home. I took Dillan and Ashley to their first baseball practice of the year – cold! Boys took baths.

item.title: Status Update – April 9, 2018
item.description: Daycare called work, Bruce has red eye, picked him up, went to doctor, no problem, ate lunch at Steak ‘n’ Shake. Crossroads keeping our deposit. Worked from home with Bruce. Took Dwyane and Bruce to baseball practice, Ashley went with. Lesa took Dillan to Scouts, I picked him up.

item.title: Status Update – April 8, 2018
item.description: Shoals Christian Church, helped Open Arms with fostering outreach. Drove by Williams Dam on way home, flood stage, scary, highway closed, drove country roads home. Open Arms Celebration showed video testimony of us and kids, magic show. Dinner at Cinco de Mayo in Lyons. Long day!

item.title: Status Update – April 7, 2018
item.description: Dillan, Ashley baseball practice canceled, too cold. Loaded, hauled trash, Dillan helped, Dwyane rode with. Lesa took Dwyane to Western Skateland, classmate birthday party. Dunham’s Sports for Bruce’s baseball glove, Walmart for misc. stuff, Frostys. Kids played outside nice day!

item.title: Status Update – April 6, 2018
item.description: Friday! Worked from home. Lesa took Bruce to kindergarten screening, did well on math, average on rest, going to school this fall, last of the kids to start school, growing fast, awesome and sad both. Lesa went to work, grocery shopping. Picked up kids, ate pizza, Bambi II movie.

item.title: Status Update – April 5, 2018
item.description: Lots of meetings. No rain! Picked up kids and Lesa, went to Dwyane and Bruce’s first baseball practice of season, Bruce’s first ever. BNL HS for NLCS Art Fair. Saw Dillan and Ashley’s artwork. UPS Store, renewed PO Box. Asian Pearl to eat dinner; saw Presley, Sarah, and Chandler.

item.title: Status Update – April 4, 2018
item.description: Decent day, worked 9.5 hours, the new norm. Lesa trying to quit smoking, on Chantix; totally stressed, grouchy, irritable; understandable. We’re going to stick with Imagination Station in Oolitic, Jessica and Annetta bought it. Went to H&R Block to file taxes, left our paperwork.

item.title: Status Update – April 3, 2018
item.description: Stormed bad last night, kept everyone awake. Workday was decent. Left early, Dillan and Ashley’s IEP meeting; Dillan’s ADHD needs addressed, affecting performance, Lesa and teachers agree; Ashley stops speech at end of year. Stormed all day, tornado watches. Girl Scouts canceled.

item.title: Status Update – April 1, 2018
item.description: Worked ticket from 5:00-10:30a, missed Deacon breakfast and Bruce’s Easter performance, pissed off, worked 12:00-3:00p, screw this job! Bruce better, Lesa wore out. Nice day, Dillan rode dirt bike, Ashley played with Dwyane. Lesa grocery shopped. Golden Corral to give Lesa break.

item.title: Status Update – March 31, 2018
item.description: Bruce’s throat swollen/red, doctor visit, has strep throat. Late start for Easter 2018 in Fortville, ate dinner, had Easter egg hunt, kids had good time! Avery and Bonnie Dellinger’s 50th anniversary. Left early, Easter dinner at parents; Jim, Sarah and Kaleigh, Becky and family.

item.title: Status Update – March 30, 2018
item.description: Good Friday! School open, daycare closed, kids car riders today. Stayed home with Bruce, worked from home. Semi-productive day, closed another auction. fifty hour week easy. Met Lesa at Budget, returned rental, back in Jeep. Looked at car on way home, didn’t like. Pizza! No rain!

item.title: Status Update – March 29, 2018
item.description: Today was better, 6 hours of meetings, still managed to get some work done. Lesa able to drop off Crossroads paperwork, pick up kids, feed them before I got home. As soon as I got home we left for school Literacy Fair, kids bought books, had fun with friends. Ate when I got home.

item.title: Status Update – March 28, 2018
item.description: Another hard work day, I’m not keeping up with workload, moving me to Times-Mail in Bedford, I’m okay with that. Lesa tried to turn in Crossroads Daycare paperwork but missed the woman by a few minutes. Picked up kids at 5:29pm, 1 minutes to spare. Lesa getting better, kids well.

item.title: Status Update – March 27, 2018
item.description: Rained hard all morning. Auction woes at work, Michelle rubbing me wrong way, reconsidering my position in company. Everyone seems healthier today! Left work late once again, barely got kids. Daycare winding down, wanting to know our last day. Work followed me home. Baths and TV.

item.title: Status Update – March 26, 2018
item.description: Everybody went to work, school, or daycare. Sick people doing better too. Picked up Lesa’s Jeep, parked it at work. Had last minute high-priority ticket as I was leaving, drove down highway with laptop and hotspot. Picked kids up late. Pizza. Bear Carnival a hit, kids enjoyed it!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 26, 2018
item.description: Lesa to Bruce: You shyster. Bruce: I know, I’m doing my job.

item.title: Status Update – March 25, 2018
item.description: I took Dillan, Dwyane to church; Lesa, Bruce, Ashley sick, stayed home, watched movies. Made Toilet Toss game for Bear’s Carnival. Lesa grocery shopped; Dillan, Dwyane played outside and on tablets; Ashley, Bruce, myself napped. Dollar General for dog food. We grilled out salmon.

item.title: Status Update – March 24, 2018
item.description: Lesa still sick. Took Pleasant to vet, it was time to put her down, kids took it well. I took kids to the Pinewook Derby races, Dillan placed 1st, 3rd, 2nd, and 1st again, he was very pleased with car. Spent afternoon burying Pleasant in the sleet and snow. Bruce is getting sick.

item.title: Status Update – March 22, 2018
item.description: Roads clear. Really hard day for me, worked 7a-5p non-stop. Missed Crossroads Daycare tour, Lesa able to go, she likes the place. She rented car for another week, Jeep needs engine wiring harness, going aftermarket. Picked up kids, forgot Bruce’s eye drops again. Lesa sick – flu?

item.title: Status Update – March 21, 2018
item.description: Lots of snow, 2-hr delay, let kids sleep extra hour. Horrible workday, would get another job if it wasn’t for the money – working for family. Lesa took online class from home. Kroger for Dwyane’s milk, picked up kids at 5:25p, just made it! Dillan struggling with math. I’m tired.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 21, 2018
item.description: Bruce, pointed at the strawberry shortcake Lesa made for dessert, and said: I’ll take that piece!

item.title: Status Update – March 20, 2018
item.description: First day of Spring, daycare took Bruce, very busy workday. Lesa picked up Ashley, took her to Girl Scouts. I worked over, picked up boys, got home, went back, forgot Bruce’s eye drops. Snowed hard all afternoon and night. Lesa barely got home! Several inches, kids went sledding!

item.title: Status Update – March 19, 2018
item.description: Bruce had pinkeye, came back from daycare with him. Tried working from home, Internet too slow. Doctor called in script to CVS, picked up. Verizon wants $130 month for hot spot, no way! Steak ‘n’ Shake with Bruce. Watched movies. Lesa picked up school kids. Took Dillan to Scouts.

item.title: Status Update – March 18, 2018
item.description: Church with kids, Lesa stayed home. Kids played outside: Dillan, Dwyane rode bikes; Ashley, Bruce played with slime. Lesa took kids for another walk in woods, visited sink hole again, boys asked to see giant sink holes on Internet. Ashley organized her photo album. Laid back day.

item.title: Status Update – March 17, 2018
item.description: Up early, drove 1½ hours to Owensville, helped present Open Arms foster workshop, different, not sure we’ll do it again, on way drove by Nicolle and grandparents’ houses. Late lunch at Pizza Hut in Princeton, used Ashley and Dwyane’s reading vouchers. At home kids played outside.

item.title: Status Update – March 16, 2018
item.description: Snoozed alarm ½ hour, let kids sleep in. Took kids to Bedford Parks Dept. office to get Father-Daughter Dance pics, Mother-Son Movie tickets; daycare after. Lesa PTO, took paperwork to JC’s Playhouse daycare, bought groceries. Dollar General for candy; got gas. Pizza! Watched TV.

item.title: Status Update – March 15, 2018
item.description: Drove together. Finally have network access; busy, busy, busy at work! Lesa picked up car, I got my truck back! Lesa taking tomorrow off. Warm day, in the 60s, kids played outside at daycare and home. New laptop backpack arrived. Looked at new pay stub, $500 extra per pay period!

item.title: Status Update – March 14, 2018
item.description: Drove in together, Lesa reserved a car, pick up tomorrow. Had stressful, productive day. Warmer day, kids played outside, Dwyane got angry, broke Dillan’s Laser Tag game, kids did nothing but argue and bicker. Lesa bought Ashley first Little House on the Prairie book – she loves!

item.title: Status Update – March 13, 2018
item.description: We drove in together. Couldn’t connect to servers from work, unresolved when Lesa picked me up after work. We tried to get a rental, nothing available until Friday due to Spring Break. Got kids, went to Thornton Park, creepy guy was there. Went to JC’s Playhouse for daycare tour.

item.title: Status Update – March 12, 2018
item.description: Kids on Spring Break, stayed at daycare, sucks! Lesa stayed home. Worked. Got kids: talked to Annetta, Jenny, and Chandler about daycare closing; we’re going to be in trouble! Salmon for supper. Rusty Nut can’t work on Jeep for four weeks! Picked it up, took it to Tire ‘n’ Wheel.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 12, 2018
item.description: Lesa was following us in the Jeep. Bruce said: Eat our dust Mommy!

item.title: Adult Quote of the Day – February 27, 2018
item.description: Dave, commenting on the clerk at the clothing store: That girl looked really scared. I think she thought we was all coming in.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 26, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, can I clean up the bathroom?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 23, 2018
item.description: Bruce sneezed, Lesa said: Bless you. Bruce in reply: You’re welcome.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 7, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Dwyane is a pondo because he sits sideways. Lesa: What’s a pondo? Bruce, sounding annoyed: A hippo! Lesa, sounding confused: Oh, okay?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 5, 2018
item.description: Lesa: Ashley, can you put a Pop-Tart in for Dwyane? Dwyane: No! I can fix my it! Mommy, you need to show me first.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 2, 2018
item.description: At prayer time Lesa told Dwyane: I’ll hold your arm because it looks like you just picked a booger and ate it. Dwyane: No! I was just trying to get my toenail unstuck from my teeth.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 1, 2018
item.description: [Driving home we saw two young bulls butting heads.] Dillan: It looks like they’re fighting. Dave: They are. Ashley: Probably fighting over a girl. Dave: Sounds about right. Dillan: Daddy, do you always have to fight to get the girl? Dave: Not always, but sometimes. Dillan: Daddy: Did you fight to get Mommy? Dave: I sure did! I had to fight to get her, and I had to fight to keep her!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 22, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, where do babies come out from? Dave: You should ask Mommy. Dillan: From their butt! Dwyane: Eww! Ashley: I know! Dave: Bruce, go ask Mommy. Don’t listen to these guys. Dillan: From their mouth! Dave: Go ask Mommy. Bruce: Mommy, how do babies get out of bellies? Ashley: I know! I know! Lesa: From their vaginas. Ashley: I knew that. Dwyane: What’s that? Lesa: You know how boys have penises?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 19, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: When I grow up I’ll live in a hotel forever. Lesa: Hopefully you’ll grow into a young man and get a job to support yourself and get an apartment or a house. Ashley: That’s when I’ll find me a man. Dave: You don’t have to. You can get a job and maybe go to college like Dwyane. Ashley: Okay, I’ll just walk around and look pretty. Dillan: That might catch you some boys.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 18, 2018
item.description: Dillan: The chicken tastes good with the potatoes. Dave: What chicken? Dillan: What kind of chicken is it? Dave: What chicken? Ashley: That’s not chicken – it’s meat. Lesa: It’s pork.

item.title: Status Update – January 17, 2018
item.description: Tooth fairy came for Dillan. No school again! We worked, kids at daycare. Kids were so bored: watched movies and played Wii, games, toys – boring! At home acted like crazy kids, full of energy. Dwyane still coughing. Put kids to bed early. I spent night doing Pablo diary entries.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 17, 2018
item.description: Bruce: I’m bored. Lesa: Go play. Bruce: Hey, I know! The kitty litter box needs cleaned out.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 12, 2018
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa: I said a bad word and I already put soap in my mouth.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 11, 2018
item.description: Bruce, when we told him to stop: What? I didn’t do nothing.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 8, 2018
item.description: Bruce, at the dinner table, trying to upset Ashley whose favorite animal is a rabbit: Do you know what my favorite animal is? Bruce, before anyone could respond: Foxes eating bunnies! Ha, ha, ha! Bruce: Why did the bunny cross the road? Dave and Lesa: Why? Bruce: To get hit by a car! Ha, ha, ha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 3, 2018
item.description: Dwyane, yesterday, in a pleading voice: Mommy, when are we going back to school?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 21, 2017
item.description: The boys woke up before light and were in their room playing with the door closed. Lesa saw the bathroom light was on and turned it off. The boys noticed the bathroom light wasn’t shining under their door anymore and it got really quiet in their room. Then Lesa heard Dwyane say: Remember, God is with you, God is with you. Then the door cracked open, and Bruce slowly stuck his head out the door.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 20, 2017
item.description: Ashley, tapping her feet to the Christmas music at dinner: My feet are talented. Lesa: My toes are talented! I can pick up LEGOs with them! Ashley: Mine are too! I can pick up TWO LEGOs with these two toes right here (she put her feet on the table to show us which toes). Dave and Lesa: Get your feet off the table! [Ashley got down from the table and demonstrated by picking up two LEGOs.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 19, 2017
item.description: Dillan, on the way to Scouts: Daddy, I love and like you. Dave: I love and like you too. Dillan: You’re the best. Dave: Well, thanks Dillan. A lot of kids probably think their dad is the best. They can’t all be the best. I’m probably just an okay dad. Dillan: No, you are the best. That’s my opinion. Dave: Thanks Dillan! Dillan: Do you know why you’re the best? Dave: No, why?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 14, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, I got you two coloring sheets for Christmas. Dave: Don’t tell me, I don’t want to know. I want to be surprised. Ashley: Yeah, but you don’t know what kind. Dave: Well, okay. Speaking of Christmas, what should we get Mommy? Dillan and Ashley both shouted: JEWELRY! Bruce: A ring with a big sparkly thing on it. Dave: Besides jewelry what can we get her? Bruce: Peace and quiet!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 7, 2017
item.description: After Lesa kissed and hugged Dwyane, said goodbye and wished him a good day, he said (while doing a fist pump in the air): Yes! I will have a GREAT day! It’s the Zipping Contest today! YES!!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 4, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, giving Lesa his Sunday School project: Wait, there’s something else in there! There’s candy. Lesa: I don’t see any candy. Dwyane: Oh yeah, I already ate it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 1, 2017
item.description: When we walked into daycare some kid yelled: Here come the Williamses! I’m still not used to hearing that.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 27, 2017
item.description: Dave: Ashley, do you want to go to the grocery store with Lesa or to Lowe’s with me? Ashley: Daddy, I’ve spent my whole life going places with you. Ever since I’ve known you. I’ve only been someplace with Mommy one time! I want to go with Mommy. Dave: Just one place huh? Okay, you better go with Mommy then. Ashley: Don’t worry Daddy, I still love you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 16, 2017
item.description: Lesa during our spaghetti dinner: Daddy can cook too you know. Ashley: He makes good pancakes. Lesa: He can make good spaghetti too. Remember he made spaghetti when I went to Wisconsin? Dillan: Yeah, but not as good as Mommy! Mommy has a secret sauce called “Mommy” that gets into everything and makes it taste yummy!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 14, 2017
item.description: While going through Dwyane’s weekly reading test results, Lesa said: Dwyane, we need to read your books more, and you need to start sounding out words. Dwyane, handing Lesa his neatly written ABC’s, said: Here, look at this. This should make you happier.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 8, 2017
item.description: Lesa, to Ashley after Hope Harvest: What did you have at Steak ‘n’ Shake? Ashley: A hamburger and cheese, and fries, and a chocolate shake with no cherry. Lesa: Did you order it that way? Ashley: Yeah. Lesa: Did you at least get whipped cream? Ashley: Yeah, I have to have whipped cream or I will die.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 3, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, I could smell the bacon and eggs all the way down by the truck because my nose grew while you weren’t looking so I could smell them.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 1, 2017
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa after accidentally losing Dillan’s Halloween straw: Don’t tell Dillan that I lost it. Tell him Bruce did it because I’m not that bad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 30, 2017
item.description: While Lesa was cooking dinner Ashley said: Mmmm, I love that! [… a long pause…] What is it?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 27, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, acting surprised: Mommy, your name is Lesa?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 24, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy and Daddy have cooties. They’re married.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 23, 2017
item.description: Lesa to the kids: Abraham Lincoln was born in Kentucky. Ashley: Abraham Lincoln should have been the first president. Dave: George Washington was a pretty good president too. Ashley: Was George Washington one of the presidents when you guys was alive?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 13, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Who’s coming to visit? Dave: Our friends Dennis and Tricia. Bruce: Who is that? Dave: You remember them. We went to their house and had a bonfire a little while ago. They have the cows. Bruce: Oh yeah, I remember them. Are they bringing the cows too? Dave: Maybe, but the cows’ll have to stay on the deck. They can’t come in the house. Ashley: Those cows were the sneaky kind of cows.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 6, 2017
item.description: Bruce, being totally serious: Daddy, you don’t ever want to squeeze what is called testicles because it hurts, and you won’t want to even move! Dave, being serious back: Is that so? Well, that’s good to know. Lesa: And it can keep you from helping to have babies when you get married. Bruce: I don’t want any babies! They have poopy pants!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 2, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Mommy. Mommy. Mommy! Mommmmmy!! Bruce: Daddy, do you know where Mommy is? Dillan: She’s in Heaven. Dave: She’s probably out by the chicken coup getting eggs and stuff. Bruce: The coyotes probably got her cause I yelled out there already. Dillan: I told you she’s in Heaven.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 26, 2017
item.description: [This is funny because there’s a real possibility Dillan would have answered differently.] Lesa: Dillan, are you outside with your clothes on? Dillan: Yeah. Lesa: And your underwear too? Dillan: Yeah. Lesa: Okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I was good. I was good all day. Dave: That’s awesome! Mommy will be so happy too! Bruce: I tried super hard to be super good so you’d be super happy. Dave: I am super happy! You did a super job! Mommy will be super happy too! Bruce: Daddy, don’t tell Mommy. I will tell Mommy I did super good when we get home.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 20, 2017
item.description: Dave: You kids be civilized. Ashley: That means don’t be bad, be good. Dwyane: I sometimes have trouble doing that. Lesa: I know. It’s hard!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 15, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, after Lesa took away some old phones from Dillan and Ashley: Mommy, you are the key master. You take everyone’s phone.

item.title: Status Update – September 13, 2017
item.description: Much better on time this morning. Texts from Annetta regards Bruce’s behavior, don’t know what to do, find new daycare, Kozy Kids? Miserable at work, full blown cold. Wanted to go to Walmart, Lesa needed me home to control kids. Reading and spelling with Ashley, math with Dillan.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 13, 2017
item.description: Bruce, to Lesa: I’m going to stay up and go to bed with you because it’s not fair that you get to stay up and eat popcorn.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 6, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, after hearing us tell Bruce he needed to behave at daycare, told Bruce: When you get old like me you will have to behave – or you will die.

item.title: Status Update – September 5, 2017
item.description: Back to work, sore and stiff from camping. Lesa took day off. Not only on time, but early! Got call from Jessica Smith at daycare, Bruce hitting, cussing, disrupting. Called Lesa, she picked him up before they kicked him out. Ashley started Scouts at Needmore, I watched the boys.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 5, 2017
item.description: [After watching Boss Baby with the kids, the kids showed visible pride at being part of a family.] Dwyane, sticking his chest out: We used to be Moffett kids but now we’re Williams kids! Dillan, in reply, shouted: I don’t know no Moffett kids! Ashley: You guys must have 5 hearts to love all of us! Bruce: Can you come sit with me?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 30, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, would a school bus squash your truck? Dave: Yup, it would certainly make a mess. Dillan: Would it kill us? Dave: Maybe could. Dillan: That bus was on our side, that’s dangerous. Dave: Yup, but you notice I gave it all the room I could. I wouldn’t want to hit a school bus. Dillan: Cause it’d squash us? Ashley: Because of the children. Dave: Exactly Ashley. And I don’t want squashed.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 21, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, eating his hamburger at dinner, looked at Lesa and said: We have the meat!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 16, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Ashley, how was your day at school? Ashley: It’s weird. All these people were here last year. It’s all the same people. It feels like I’m still in first grade. Lesa: You’re growing up with everybody you know. Isn’t that kind of cool? Ashley: No, not really.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 15, 2017
item.description: Bruce, on the morning after his new haircut: Look Mommy, I still have my hair cut! Dwyane: Me too! Bruce: I don’t think Ashley still has her’s though.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 14, 2017
item.description: Bruce, running into the dining room: Mommy, I was running so fast I pooped my pants! Lesa: Uuhh … quit running! Uuhh … quit … uuhh … running! … Uuhh! Dave: Bruce, walk, don’t run, out back and take off your pants so I can hose you down.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 8, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, what are we having for supper? Lesa: Frozen pizzas. Dwyane: But I don’t want ice pizza!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 7, 2017
item.description: [Bruce was helping Lesa in the kitchen while she was cooking dinner. He helped with the eggs, then he wanted to help with something else. Bruce noticed that the plastic container drawer wasn’t closed. Lesa told him it wouldn’t close because the plastic containers needed to be organized. Bruce went ahead and organized it for Lesa! Wow! It closes now.] Then Lesa wanted to feed the chickens. She handed Bruce an ear of corn and asked him to shuck it (he’s shucked corn before).

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 2, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, I’m full of chocolate.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 1, 2017
item.description: Dillan, on the Ferris Wheel: This can’t be good. Can we go down now and make them stop? Ashley, on the Ferris Wheel: Daddy, I don’t want to sit by you. I want to go by myself! Dwyane, on the Ferris Wheel: I’m gonna die! I’m gonna die! I’m gonna die! I’m gonna die! Bruce, on the Ferris Wheel: This is so awesome! This is so awesome! This is so awesome!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 28, 2017
item.description: Bruce: No! Lesa: Bruce, are you arguing with me? Bruce: I am Momma. Lesa: Well, I think you should stop, don’t you? Bruce: Okay Momma.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 27, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, how was your day? Lesa: It was good. Bruce: Did the house fall on you? Lesa: No. Bruce: Did the tree? Lesa: No!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 24, 2017
item.description: Bruce, to Lesa: I found a job. My job is being bad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce, at swim lessons: My eyes hurt when I open them underwater. Lesa: Maybe you shouldn’t open them? Bruce, walking away: I’ll tell my boss I’m not going to anymore.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 20, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, can we go to the county fair tonight? Dave: No, we have swim lessons. But Mommy and me are planning to take you kids to the fair in a week or two. Dwyane: No, I want to go to the COUNTY fair. Dave: Right, we’re going to go to the Monroe County Fair. Dwyane: NO, THE COUNTY FAIR. Dave: Right, the COUNTY FAIR. I got it now.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 7, 2017
item.description: Bruce, at Pizza Hut, to our shock and dismay, said loudly: Oh my God! Look at that butt!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 6, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Rain, rain, go away. Come back another day. Bruce started a second round and we joined in: Rain, rain, go away. Come back another day. Bruce, incredulous and amazed, asked: How do you know that song‽

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 5, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy and Daddy, thanks for taking us to all the places you take us.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 29, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, with a big grin: Mommy, if Daddy dies before you do, I’m going to marry you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 23, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, you’re beautiful. Lesa: Thank you! Dwyane: Mommy, am I handsome? Lesa: You are!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 22, 2017
item.description: Lesa put on her new pajamas and Ashley said: Mommy, those are pretty. You should wear them to church.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 21, 2017
item.description: Dillan, after riding his bike in the rain: Mommy, that was awesome! The road flooded and I rode my bike in it! I was pretending there was tornadoes!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 20, 2017
item.description: Dwyane during his evening prayer Sunday night: Thank you for letting Mommy in my heart. Thank you for letting Daddy in my heart. Thank you for letting Jesus and God in my heart. I love you God.

item.title: Adult Quote of the Day – June 15, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Boy, you sure can tell DCS doesn’t visit anymore when you see the kids’ bathroom.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 13, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Mommy, I ate some watermelon seeds. Will a watermelon grow in my belly? Lesa: I’ve eaten hundreds of them and haven’t had one grow yet. Ashley: I’ve ate tons and tons of watermelon seeds and I haven’t grown a single watermelon in my stomach. If I did I would feel something strange in my belly and probably would be too full to eat.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 12, 2017
item.description: [Kid Quotes related to Fairfax Beach] Bruce, before we even got to the beach: This is the best day ever! Dillan while at the beach: Daddy, can you check your calendar for next Sunday? Dave: Why? Dillan: To see if we can come back. Dwyane at supper: This is the greatest day ever! Ashley’s corrected him saying: The greatest days ever is when we was born, and when we was adopted, and then today.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 9, 2017
item.description: Walking past the jewelery cabinet at Walmart, Ashley said: Daddy, is this where you got your wedding ring? Dave: No, Walmart wasn’t invented when Mommy and me got married. Ashley: Wow, that was a really long time ago. Dave: You don’t have to tell me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 8, 2017
item.description: [Bruce refused to go into the dentist’s examination room – not even with Dwyane or Lesa.] Lesa: How come you don’t want to go in there? Bruce: Because he will cut off my head!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 2, 2017
item.description: Lesa: How can you be hungry when you just ate lunch? Bruce: Because we’re the hungry people!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 1, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: These shoes are tight. Dave: Are they getting small? Dwyane: No, my feet are getting big. I like when they’re tight cause they don’t fall off. Dave: Ah, makes sense. Lesa: I just checked those shoes! They’re not too small, they fit perfect.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 31, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, sometimes when I pretend to sleep I fall asleep.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 19, 2017
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa: Do I look sharp? Lesa: Holy moly! You look sharp!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 17, 2017
item.description: Dillan looking for his homework after doing it: I’m getting like mommy! I put things down then don’t remember where I put it!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 10, 2017
item.description: Lesa to Dwyane: Good job using the wash rag to clean your face. Dwyane: Cause I’m a smart kid … and strong!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 9, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, it’s almost Mother’s Day. Dave: I know, and I haven’t gotten Mommy anything yet. Dwyane: We should get her flowers. Dave: Flowers are nice. Mommy likes flowers but flowers don’t last very long. That’s kind of what makes them special though. Bruce: Get her a ring! Dave: A ring? Bruce: What goes on her ears. Dave: You mean earrings. Bruce: Yeah, they’ll last until fireworks time! Dwyane: Yeah, I think Mommy needs rings.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 8, 2017
item.description: Ashley to Dave last night at dinner: Mommy made the ketchup on the meat loaf. Dave: I know, Mommy used to make real ketchup and it was yummy! Dillan: Can you make some more? Lesa: No, not for awhile. I don’t have time to any more. Dillan: Why not? Lesa: I traded my flower and vegetable gardens for a kid garden. Lesa: Now I plant seeds, feed, water, weed, and tend to children with love.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 3, 2017
item.description: While riding in the car, Lesa asked: Bruce, Why are your shoes off? Bruce replied: Dwyane took my shoes off. Dwyane: Did not! Bruce: Did! Dwyane: Did not! Lesa: Bruce, how did Dwyane do that when you’re sitting way over there? Bruce: He has rubber arms that stretch.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 2, 2017
item.description: Lesa to Dave: I can’t believe all the flooding! Dwyane, in a panic: Is God going to flood the Earth again‽ Lesa: No. Don’t worry, we’re way up on a hill and God promised us he wouldn’t do that again. Ashley to Dwyane: That’s why we have rainbows Dwyane.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 1, 2017
item.description: On the way to church, Lesa said: Dwyane, you look sharp! Ashley: I’m not sharp, I’m pretty. Lesa: Yes you are pretty and the boys look handsome. That’s what looking sharp means.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 28, 2017
item.description: Bruce was sitting in Lesa’s lap watching TV. He pointed at each breast and love handle while counting: One, two, three, four. Mommy, you have four boobies!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 26, 2017
item.description: Bruce: I was on a plane! Lesa: You remember that? Awesome! Wasn’t that cool? Bruce: My ears were popping. Lesa: They were hard to pop. Dillan: Mine didn’t pop until a couple of days ago.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 24, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: We saw a movie. Ashley: Oh, I didn’t get to see it! Dave: That’s because I took you to a square dance, remember? Dillan: Yeah, Mommy drove us and got there all on her own!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 18, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Did everyone brush their teeth? Dillan: Ashley didn’t, but I did 79 times! Can you tell?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 14, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, did you fire Daddy?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 13, 2017
item.description: Ashley, talking about the order of morning hugs and kisses: I know why Mommy kisses Daddy last. She saves the best for last!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 12, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Dillan, hurry up and finish your bath. Dillan: Mommy, do you know what I’m doing? Lesa: Playing in the bath? Dillan, excited: I’m bombing boats! Did you know there was a war with England? Lesa: Yes, I knew that. Dillan: You know that song? Lesa: Yeah. Dillan, getting very excited now: The guy that wrote that was really there! Can you imagine that?!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 7, 2017
item.description: Dillan: What is this? Dave: It’s barbecue beef. Lesa: Pork, not beef. Dave: You know what I meant. Bruce: Mint? I want a mint!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 3, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Bruce, you are causing too much trouble at daycare! Bruce: But Mommy, I can run faster than the teacher.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 28, 2017
item.description: Ashley, who often gets “sick” when it’s bedtime: Daddy, when I’m with you I don’t feel sick but when you leave I feel sick. Dave: Is that so? That’s kind of amazing. And only at bedtime! Ashley: Yeah, it’s like your love is medicine soaking into me. Dave: Better not let Lesa hear that or she’ll be the one getting sick! She’ll want to baarrrffff!!!!! [Then we had a good laugh about that.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 27, 2017
item.description: Lesa stayed home from church and before I drove even one mile Dwyane said: This is a long road far from our house. I sure do miss Mommy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 9, 2017
item.description: Ashley, doing an impression of Lesa doing an impression of Zsa Zsa Gabor: I love you I love you I love you dahling! Mommy says that all the time!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 6, 2017
Kid Quote of the Day – March 3, 2017
item.description: Ashley to Dave: Can you make me a sack lunch today? I didn’t want to bother Mommy because she was working and she always works and I didn’t want to make more work for her so I didn’t ask her.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 27, 2017
item.description: Ashley, asking about our PAVA PO Box: Was anything in it?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 23, 2017
item.description: Ashley, super excited: Mommy! Guess what!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce, during bath time, in a panic yells: Daddy, Dwyane has a big scratch on his bottom!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 15, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I made a heart for you and Mommy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 9, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, to Lesa: Mommy, I’ve been having bad dreams.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 2, 2017
item.description: Ashley, after vomiting in my truck on the way home last night: That looks like …

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 31, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, to Lesa: I want a little brother.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 27, 2017
item.description: [Dwyane can’t wait to be in kindergarten. He wants to be like the older kids.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 25, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, dancing to a song on Spirit 95: Mommy, do I got the moves?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 24, 2017
item.description: Dave, getting the kids ready this morning: Okay kids, if you haven’t noticed, I overslept this morning. Now what I need you to do is to help me out by not messing around or fighting with each other.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 23, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Whew! What’s that smell?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 18, 2017
item.description: [There’s been a lot of talk about adoption since we’re really close.] Dwyane, to Lesa: When you adopt us we’ll shout from the roof top! Lesa: Yes we will! Ashley, to Dave: And we’ll have a big party! Dave: Yes we will!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 16, 2017
item.description: The table next to us had a child that said Mommy, and Bruce said to Lesa: Why they calling you Mommy?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 13, 2017
item.description: Dillan, to Dwyane: Don’t be afraid of anything when Daddy drives. Be afraid when Mommy drives.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 11, 2017
item.description: Ashley, to Lesa: What are those? Dave: They’re Mommy’s “Sick and Tired of Kids” pills. Ashley: I don’t think they make pills for that. Dave: Well, they should. Lesa: They’re my new vitamins Ashley.

item.title: Adult Quote of the Day – December 30, 2016
item.description: Lesa: Dwyane! Get your nose out of the dog’s butt! That’s yucky nasty!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 28, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, I know why God didn’t give you and Daddy babies of your own. Lesa: Why? Ashley: He was saving you for us!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 21, 2016
item.description: Bruce, playing: Mommy, monsters are eating my family! Lesa, playing along: Are you going to save them? Bruce: No! You save them!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 13, 2016
item.description: Bruce to Lesa during supper: What is that? Lesa: Fish oil pill. [Twenty minutes later.] Lesa: What does everyone want for dessert? Bruce: Fish oil.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 5, 2016
item.description: Ashley, during supper: When I grow up I will get a boyfriend, and we will get married, and I’ll will have babies, one boy and one girl, and I will buy a house, and I will drive over to get Dave and Lesa to live in my house, and I will take care of them and cook every night, and my house will have three bedrooms – one for the kids to share, and one for Dave and Lesa to share, and one for me and my husband to share – and Dave and Lesa can have the love seat, and me and my husband will have the couch, and Dave and Lesa can share the love seat with the kids if they want.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 2, 2016
item.description: Bruce at supper started shouting: I’m on Olde Farm Road! Olde Farm Road! Dave: Bruce, why are you shouting that? Ashley: We was waiting for you, and Mommy called you, and you kept saying “Where you at? I can’t hear you.” and Mommy kept saying “I’m on Olde Farm Road.” and she was yelling it so you could hear, but you didn’t hear. Bruce: Olde Farm Road! Olde Farm Road! Dave: Okay, okay, I get it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 28, 2016
item.description: Dave to Ashley: No one can know everything – except God. Lesa, sarcastically: And Daddy. Daddy knows everything. Dave, sarcastically back: Yeah, I do know everything – except the Second Coming. Ashley: That’s next week.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 25, 2016
item.description: Dwyane dropped his deviled egg and said: Mommy, can I have another rotten egg? I dropped mine.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 23, 2016
item.description: While Lesa was making bread pudding Dillan said: That smells so yummy my knees are getting weak! [Then he pretended to faint.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 21, 2016
item.description: Lesa, after Ashley spilled her water during supper: Oh, I’m melting! I’m melting! Dave being silly started talking like a Munchkin: Mommy’s the wicked witch! Follow the … Dillan, interrupting: … red brick road! Follow the red brick road! Ashley: That’s from the Wizard! Bruce: They died on that train. Ashley: That’s right! That’s when Marcy and Eleanor took us to that hotel! Lesa: I’m surprised you remember that Bruce! Ashley: Can we go back‽ Dave: Probably not.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 18, 2016
item.description: Bruce and Dwyane were playing when Lesa overheard Bruce say: Like I always say, Daddy will fix it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 17, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, it’s my turn to help. Dave: What? Dwyane: I can help carry? [He was talking about helping with dinner. Dillan helps set the table and serve on Monday, Ashley on Tuesday, Dwyane on Wednesday, Bruce on Thursday, Dave and Lesa on Friday and weekends.] Dave: We’re going to church for dinner tonight. You can carry your own plate. That way you help Mommy by not making her carry your plate.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 14, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Can I wake up the kids? Lesa: Not right now. Dillan: I know what “not right now” means – it means no.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 31, 2016
item.description: Bruce: I’m Superman! Lesa: You’re Super Pooper!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 28, 2016
item.description: All the kids as we went out to eat: Look out Steak ‘n’ Shake! Here we come!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 27, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy? Where we going? Dave: Dillan and me are going to the Fireman Appreciation Dinner and Ashley is going to her Scout Halloween party and you boys are going to play on the playground with Mommy and then we’ll have pizza when we get home. Dwyane: The park by school? Dave: No, the park by Needmore School. Ashley: I know that park! There is a little kid park and a big kid park.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 24, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, eating a bagel with cream cheese: Look Mommy, I made hand prints for you!

item.title: Status Update – October 10, 2016
item.description: Parent teacher conference with Mrs. Wronowicz, Mrs. Anderson, Ashley doing great, Dillan having trouble, nothing to get worried about yet but I’m still worried. Dillan and Ashley had pajama day, gave pennies to support someone with cancer, they have good hearts. Scouts. Homework.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 29, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Everyone that likes Ashley raise their hand. Ashley: That’s Dave and Lesa and Bruce that like Ashley and not Dillan and Dwyane. Dillan: I like you too when you’re not so annoying. Dwyane: Me too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 22, 2016
item.description: Bruce to Dave: Go by the burned house (on Cobb Lane). Dwyane to Dave: Don’t go! Mommy will freak out!. Bruce to Dave: I won’t let Mommy freak out.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 15, 2016
item.description: Ashley: You’re a pretty Mommy and you’re a pretty Daddy and I love you both so much!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 2, 2016
item.description: What Ashley wrote on her assignment to write about a fun day: The Greatest Day. When Dave and Lesa got us and I have people in my family and I have my best mom and dad in the world. I love my mom and dad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 30, 2016
item.description: Dillan, after overhearing me tell a friend the adoption would be a few more weeks: Daddy, the adoption will be in two weeks? Dave: Yeah Dillan, it’ll be a couple of weeks, or 3, or 4, or more – however long it takes. Ashley: That’s awesome news! You guys have been waiting a long time to get to adopt us!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 26, 2016
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa: I like you more than Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 18, 2016
item.description: Ashley, running into daycare, yells to Pink Room: Mommy said we don’t have any electricity because Daddy didn’t pay the bill! Bruce: Yeah, we was camping. Dave: Mommy must be trying to get rid of her kids and husband in one fell swoop.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 17, 2016
item.description: Lesa: So Dwyane, why were you lying to me? Dwyane: I wasn’t actually lying, I just wasn’t telling the whole truth.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 12, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, we never have leftover pizza cause we eat it all!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 10, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, watching TV: I want that. Can you get me that? Lesa: I want a million dollars. Dwyane: Okay, I’ll get my piggy bank.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 9, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, when I grow up I still won’t like Brussel sprouts so you don’t have to fix me any.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 5, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Hey Mommy, I think you make the best food in the world, even peas and stuff I don’t like.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 3, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Ashley was the last to hatch. Lesa: No. Dillan: We don’t hatch. We’re born with skin. Ashley: Yeah, but really small skin.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 2, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I like the pretty sunrise. Dave: It is pretty. I like it too. Ashley: But not as pretty as me and Mommy, right? Dave: Right!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 28, 2016
item.description: Ashley at dinner: I know why they call it spaghetti. Dave and Lesa: Why? Ashley: Because you spa-slurp it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 25, 2016
item.description: While Lesa was tucking Ashley into bed Ashley said: I smell a skunk in my room. Lesa: I don’t smell a skunk. Ashley: Yeah, it’s gone away now. Ashley put her hands behind her head and propped herself up: There it is again! Lesa, laughing: I think your underarms stink. Ashley: Huh?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 21, 2016
item.description: Dave: Ashley, pick up the mess in your room. Ashley: But Bruce made that mess. Dave: But it’s in your room though. Why should we pick up after you, or wash your dirty clothes, or clean your dirty supper dishes? We didn’t make those messes. Ashley: Because you love us? Dave: Isn’t that the same reason you should pick up the mess in your room? Ashley: Okay Daddy. I’ll pick it up.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 20, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, come look! Lesa: What? Dwyane: Look at all the flies in the window! [Lesa gets a fly swatter and starts swatting flies.] Dwyane: Wow Mommy, you’re a good fly killer!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 12, 2016
item.description: Lesa: Dillan, get a tissue. Don’t pick your nose and eat it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 8, 2016
item.description: Lesa, after Dillan helped set the table: Thank you. You were very helpful. Dillan: Like always.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 1, 2016
item.description: Ashley at VBS closing: Can I have some pizza? Dave: Sure. Ashley: Can I have a cookie? Dave: Okay. Ashley: I’m thirsty, can I get something to drink? Dave: Yes. Ashley: Can I have some more pizza? Dave: No. Ashley: But I’m hungry! Dave: You ate supper, ate pizza, ate two cookies, had a Capri Sun, and drank a whole cup of lemonaide. There’s no way you’re hungry. Ashley: I’m going to starve to death!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 27, 2016
item.description: As we were going down the highway, Dwyane said: Mommy, Bruce threw his new shoes out the window.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 24, 2016
item.description: Bruce, sitting with Dave, chatting about various things, said: Lesa makes a lot of flowers.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 22, 2016
item.description: Dillan, at dinner: I ate my whole plate without drinking. Is that amazing? Ashley: No, not really. Lesa: Yes Dillan, that’s amazing.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 21, 2016
item.description: [Overheard while the kids were playing Mom and Dad.] Ashley, pretending to be Lesa: You can’t die. You can’t ever die ’cause you have to take care of the kids. Dillan, pretending to be Dave: I’m a dad and a father. Dwyane: I want to be the baby.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 20, 2016
item.description: Bruce helped me get trash together and load the trailer, then said: I want to go to trash with you Daddy. Dave: Sure! You can go with me Bruce. It’ll just be you and me. The other kids watched TV instead of helping, and then said: We want to come with you too Daddy! Dave: No, I’m already done and ready to go and you didn’t help. Ashley whined: But I want to go!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 17, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Where are you going Mommy? Lesa: Crazy. Bruce: Can I go with you?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 16, 2016
item.description: Bruce: What is this? Lesa: Cantaloupe. Bruce: Can-a-op-e? Can-a you. Ha, ha. No! Can-a Daddy! Ha, ha, ha.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 10, 2016
item.description: Dillan, to Lesa at dinner: Batman is named Bruce Wayne. Bruce: BATMAN! Dwyane: And Robin Egg! Ashley: It’s just Robin, not Robin Egg. Dwyane: Nuh-uh. It’s Robin Egg! Ashley: Daddy, is Robin named Robin Egg? Dave: It’s just Robin, not Robin Egg. Dwyane: No. It’s Robin Egg!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 8, 2016
item.description: I was tucking Ashley into bed when she said: Will you see the judge tomorrow? Dave, knowing Ashley thinks I have casual conversations with her, said: Yes I will see her and if I get the chance, I will ask her to please, please, please let us keep the Moffett kids. Ashley: Daddy, can you write that down so you won’t forget to ask her that? Dave: Ashley, I could never forget how much I love you guys.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 30, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, watching Ashley’s graduation on video: Mommy, I needed to be there! You should have got me out of class to watch!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 27, 2016
item.description: Dillan getting bored at Ashley’s graduation ceremony: Mommy, I think I better go back to class now because I’m missing a lot of work!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 26, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: At night the boogers escape. Lesa: What do they do when they escape? Dwyane: I don’t know. Dillan: They’ll get and kill you! Ashley: No, they’ll dry up.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 16, 2016
item.description: Eating out at Casa Brava’s I told Dillan: You’re a mamma’s boy! Ashley piped up: I’m a drama queen!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 6, 2016
item.description: [I was in the truck getting ready to leave to take the big kids shopping for Dillan’s camping equipment.] Dillan wanted it to be a big guys only night with no girls so he said to Ashley: Ashley, you should stay home. You’re going to miss popcorn. And TV. And lemonade. Ashley thought for a minute and said: Daddy, is it okay if I don’t go? I’m kind of tired and think I should stay home.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 4, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Mommy! Let me guess what we’re having for dinner. Hmmmm, what are we having for dinner? Lesa: Hamburger Helper. Ashley: Yaaaaaa! I LOVE Hamburger Helper! Dwyane: Me hungry! What we having for lunch Mommy? Lesa: You mean dinner, Dwyane. Dwyane: What we having for dinner Mommy? Lesa: Hamburger Helper. Dwyane: Yaaaaa! Me like Hamburger Helper! Dillan: What are we having for dinner, Mommy? Lesa: Hamburger Helper. Dillan: Alright!!! I like Hamburger Helper!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 3, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I only like three boys: God, Jesus and Dave. And I only like one girl: Lesa.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 2, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, me tired. I worked hard at preschool today! (BOHOF)

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 27, 2016
item.description: [Dwyane and Bruce watched the bees buzzing around Lesa’s flowers with her one day last week and she had told them the bees were collecting nectar to make honey.] Bruce, talking about a bumble bee flying around the deck, told Lesa: The bees are trying to make honey from us, but I ducked!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 25, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Can I get a taste of that wine? Dave: Sure, but you won’t like it. [I let her have a sip.] Ashley, scrunched up her face and said: Eeww! I don’t like it!
